channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly Tipping problem has been found Watson Close., 1st July
item.description:
Fly Tipping problem has been found Watson Close.

item.title: Outside 28 Great Queen St, WC2B 5BB, 1st July
item.description:
This tree is large and will shortly grow big enough for the branches to cause damage to the adjacent buildings. Could the branches of the tree closest to the buildings be trimmed back a bit to avoid causing damage

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Great Queen Street, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree pruning, 1st July
item.description:
The location was wrong on the last report - the tree is outside No. 24. No light and can't drive under tree in van.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dangerous paving and broken paved area, 1st July
item.description:
Uneven and broken broken paving and asphalt outside entrance to scrap metal merchants and in and around the bus shelter.Not helped by the fact that vehicles from the scrap merchants have taken it upon themselves to park and off load scrap in the immediate area and pavement..
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Left hand side of the gate, 1st July
item.description:
Sunken footpath above gas valve
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Avenue Road, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blue drum fly-tipped on side of carriageway, 1st July
item.description:
I work for a construction company carrying out works on behalf of National Grid. we are currently reinstating an entrance ino Falconwood Field. This blue drum has appear on the roadside near our works. It is not connected to us or our activities

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 191, Welling Way, Avery Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mixture of rubbish and green waste, 1st July
item.description:
Rubbish been sat here over a week and nothing picked up by street cleaner nor rubbish van that collect rubbish once a week. Lots of leaves need clearing up too.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Buckingham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outdoor seating area of Akatuki - 30-31 Great Queen Street, WC2B 5BB, 1st July
item.description:
The pavement light is broken and can be completely removed. This poses as a high risk danger to someone sat outside on a chair, as the leg can fall through. It also creates a security and practical issue for the tenants within the basement, as people can see their items stored and water can ingress into their property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Great Queen Street, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: CROFTS HOUSE & APRIL HOUSE - TEALE STREET - Grass not cut, piles of leaves, weeds growing, hedges & trees not trimmed., 1st July
item.description:
CROFTS HOUSE & APRIL HOUSE - TEALE STREET - Grass not cut, piles of leaves, weeds growing, hedges & trees not trimmed.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Teale Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Suspicious abandoned vehicle, 1st July
item.description:
Abandoned vehicle with flat tyres has not been moved since 19th June and did not permit road markings being applied on 27th June. Flat tyres, suspicious additional number plate on windscreen. Seen multiple times in early June 2025 driving dangerously and erratically in the local area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Hazel Lane, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of sofa, 1st July
item.description:
Sofa left on Friday 27th June evening. I saw it being carried by two people along greenway close and across green lanes, assumed they were taking it to a van but found this on sat. Likely there is CCTV footage captured from front of Sainsburys.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Casbeard Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Bags of Builders Waste Dumped on Kerbside, 1st July
item.description:
Two large bags of builders waste have been left dumped on the kerbside outside 63 Waverley Road for the past several weeks and are preventing the space from being used for parking. Can the local team please remove them. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waverley Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clyde Vale is awash with litter, 1st July
item.description:
The curb and pavement on the side where the industrial centre is, is full of litter. No street cleaning for weeks. Looks awful, especially in the gutters.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clyde Vale, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping near the crossing, 1st July
item.description:
Someone has dumped rubbish near the crossing. It is unsightly and not fair on the children that have to walk to school and see this in the local area. Belvedere is terrible and the council tax goes no where to fix these issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant Dumping of Rubbish, 1st July
item.description:
House Number 90a constantly dumps rubbish allowing foxes to rip the bags open. The Chinese shop across from them has video evidence that this is a constant occurrence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead tree could fall into our property, 1st July
item.description:
There is a dead tree at 48 Ashburnham Grove that is leaning over our property. We have been advised by a tree surgeon on our property that there is a danger it could fall.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Devonshire Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More furniture outside 14 Firbank Road, 1st July
item.description:
More furniture/rubbish has been left outside 14 Firbank Road. Has been moved around (probably by the person who dumbed it) including on Saskia Mews entrance. Thanks for looking into this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Firbank Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
